action.action-desc: Mr. Blumenauer introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Food Security Act of 1985 to improve conservation compliance, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Sustainable Farmland for the Future Act.
Section 1201(a) of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3801(a)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (3)—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking highly erodible and inserting covered; and
in subparagraph (B), by striking the highly erodible and inserting covered;

paragraph.text: in paragraph (4)—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking ; and and inserting a semicolon;
by amending subparagraph (B) to read as follows:
are designed to, in a cost effective and technically practicable manner—

clause.text: achieve a substantial improvement in water quality;
achieve a rate of soil erosion no greater than the soil loss tolerance level, as determined by the Natural Resources Conservation Service;
establish and maintain a minimum of 50 feet of perennial vegetation between covered cropland and intermittent or perennial waterways; and

subparagraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

are based on the most recent and technically accurate soil erosion prediction models to determine if soil erosion by wind and water exceed the Soil Loss Tolerance Level on covered cropland subject to subtitle B.

paragraph.text: in paragraph (6), by striking highly erodible and inserting covered;
by amending paragraph (7)(A)(ii) to read as follows:

clause.text: before such action, such land was wetland.

paragraph.text: in paragraph (9), by striking Any highly erodible land on which an agricultural commodity is produced after December 23, 1985, and that is not exempt under section 1212, shall be considered as part of the field in which the land was included on December 23, 1985, unless the owner and Secretary agree to modification of the boundaries of the field to carry out this title.; and
by adding at the end the following:
The term covered cropland means cropland, as defined in section 718.2 of title 7, Code of Federal Regulations, that is planted to a row crop.

subsection.text: Subtitle B of title XII of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3811 et seq.) is amended in the heading by striking Highly Erodible Land and inserting Covered Cropland.

section.text: Section 1212 of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3812) is amended—

paragraph.text: by amending subsection (a) to read as follows:

subsection.header: Eligibility based on compliance with conservation plan

paragraph.text: If, as of January 1, 2023, or 2 years after the Natural Resources Conservation Service has completed a conservation plan for the farm, whichever is later, a person is actively applying the approved conservation plan, such person shall have until January 1, 2028, to comply with the plan without being subject to program ineligibility.

In carrying out this subsection, the Secretary, Natural Resources Conservation Service, and local soil conservation districts shall minimize the quantity of documentation a person must submit to comply with this paragraph.
On the expiration of a contract entered into under subchapter B of chapter 1 of subtitle D, the provisions of this subtitle shall apply to the acreage that was the subject of such contract.
by striking subsections (b), (c), and (d);
by redesignating subsections (e), (f), (g), and (h) as subsections (b), (c), (d), and (e), respectively; and
in subsection (c), as so redesignated, by amending paragraph (4)(A)(i) to read as follows:

clause.text: a person has failed to comply with section 1211, and has acted in good faith and without an intent to violate section 1211; or

section.header: Development and implementation of conservation plans and conservation systems
section.text: Section 1213 of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3812a) is amended—

paragraph.text: by amending subsection (d) (as redesignated by paragraph (2)) to read as follows:

section.text: Section 1221 of the Food Security Act of 1985 (16 U.S.C. 3821) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (b)(1), by inserting , including payments made under section 1116 or 1117 of the Agricultural Act of 2014 before the period at the end; and
in subsection (c)—

subparagraph.text: by amending paragraph (2)(B) to read as follows:

In the case of a wetland that the Secretary determines was converted after the date of enactment of the Agricultural Act of 2014, the person shall be ineligible to receive crop insurance premium subsidies in subsequent reinsurance years unless the Secretary determines that an exemption pursuant to section 1222 applies.
in paragraph (3), by striking subparagraph (E); and
in paragraph (4), by inserting at the end the following:

The Secretary shall make available annually an amount equal to 0.01 percent of the funding otherwise made available for programs specified in 1221(b), not to exceed $200 million, to provide technical assistance, conduct status reviews and carry out other tasks needed to fully implement the provisions of this subtitle.

The Secretary shall annually carry out a review of the status of compliance of the person with the conservation plan under which the conservation system is being applied on no less than 5 percent of the covered cropland subject to this subtitle.
